qas.question: What languages di Radio Mogadishu originally broadcast in?
What countrys assistance helped Radio Mogadishu modernize?
What type of services were offered in Somali, Amharic, and Oromo?
When was the Transitional National Government in power?

plausible_answers.text: There are a number of radio news agencies

qas.question: What is the total number of internet news located in Somalia?
When did Radio Mogadishu begin broadcasting in Italian again?

context: <b7_0>There are a number of radio news agencies<b7_0/> based in Somalia. Established <a0_0>during the colonial period<a0_0/>, Radio Mogadishu initially broadcast news items in both <a1_0>Somali and Italian<a1_0/>. The station was modernized with <a2_0><b5_0>Russian assistance<b5_0/><a2_0/> following independence in <b4_0><b8_0>1960<b8_0/><b4_0/>, and began offering <a3_0>home service<a3_0/> in Somali, Amharic and Oromo. After closing down operations in the <b6_0>early 1990s<b6_0/> due to the civil war, the station was officially re-opened in the early 2000s by the Transitional National Government. In the late 2000s, Radio Mogadishu also launched a complementary website of the same name, with news items in Somali, Arabic and English.
